title: Research: Survey existing minimal Preludes from teaching compilers
body:
Research existing trimmed-down Haskell Preludes from teaching compilers and toy implementations.

**Sources to investigate:**
- Helium (Utrecht University teaching compiler) — ships with a minimal Prelude
- UHC (Utrecht Haskell Compiler) — has its own Prelude
- Hugs — historical small Haskell implementation
- PureCake — verified lazy functional compiler (see docs/references/purecake.md)
- Jhc/Ajhc — whole-program Haskell compilers
- Reddit/Discourse posts about toy Haskell compilers
- Haskell 2010 Report Chapter 9 (standard Prelude specification)

**Deliverable:** Written document in `docs/decisions/` listing:
- Which Prelude to base ours on (or whether to write from scratch)
- Licensing compatibility
- Minimum required types, classes, and functions for M1 and M2
- What can be copied vs what must be implemented as compiler primitives
